abstract.p: Adam Borden letter on Bob Tedeschi's April 16 travel article recounts disappointing experiences using Web travel sitesl

block.p: To the Editor: Regarding Bob Tedeschi's article, ''Web Air Deals: Caveat Surfer'' (April 16), I too was disappointed with a booking Web site, skyauction.com, which I used because it offered big savings. After ''winning'' an auction to a choice of 11 European cities, I was informed that none of the cities were available when I wanted to travel, because of space limitations in the class of service for which the site had contracted.

To the Editor: Regarding Bob Tedeschi's article, ''Web Air Deals: Caveat Surfer'' (April 16), I too was disappointed with a booking Web site, skyauction.com, which I used because it offered big savings. After ''winning'' an auction to a choice of 11 European cities, I was informed that none of the cities were available when I wanted to travel, because of space limitations in the class of service for which the site had contracted.

For another auction whose reservation I had to cancel due to family illness, I still had no refund after three months. If travel companies want consumers to use the Web, then they will have to offer a moderate level of customer service.
